The standard condition is that at most one character has an odd count (for odd-length strings) or all even (for even-length). But the code here is a bit different. Wait, the code's logic:

The code counts the number of characters with odd counts. The variable cnt counts how many such characters there are. The code allows at most one such character (cnt can be 0 or 1). If more than one, then x becomes False. Then, if x is True, output "First". Else, if x is False and the length is even → output "Second". Else (x is False and length is odd) → output "First".
